SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Migrate Configuration Data Between Orgs

Most B2B Commerce solutions rely on multiple orgs for developing, testing, debugging, and deploying their storefronts. Generally, you want to propagate the same configuration settings from one org (such as a sandbox org) to another (such as a production org). You can export configuration records and use the Data Loader client application to upsert the records in a new org.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set
To execute anonymous Apex:	Author Apex
Install the Data Loader client application.
From the org that you're migrating from—the source org—use Data Loader to export records of the following B2B Commerce for Visualforce custom objects.
CC Configuration
CC Configuration Metadata
CC Configuration Module
TIP For help with exporting records, see Export Data.
Save backups of the exported records.
In the org that you're migrating to—the destination org—delete any existing records of the custom objects that you exported from the source org:
CC Configuration
CC Configuration Metadata
CC Configuration Module

You can execute the following anonymous Apex code from the Developer Console:

List<ccrz__E_Configuration__c> config = [select Id from ccrz__E_Configuration__c];
List<ccrz__E_ConfigurationMeta__c> meta = [select Id from ccrz__E_ConfigurationMeta__c];
List<ccrz__E_ConfigurationModule__c> module = [select Id from ccrz__E_ConfigurationModule__c];
delete config;
delete meta;
delete module;
In Data Loader, insert the CC Configuration Module records from the CSV file that you exported. Map the following CSV columns to object fields:
CSV FILE'S COLUMN HEADER	OBJECT'S FIELD NAME
CCRZ__APINAME__C	ccrz__APIName__c
CCRZ__CONFIGURATIONMODULEID__C	
ID	ccrz__ConfigurationModuleId__c
NAME	Name
In Data Loader, upsert the CC Configuration Metadata records from the CSV file that you exported.
In step 2a of the upsert window in Data Loader, select any field for matching—the destination org doesn't contain any data to match against.
In step 2b of the upsert window in Data Loader, select ccrz__ConfigurationModuleId__c for the external ID to use for matching.
Map the following CSV columns to object fields:
CSV FILE'S COLUMN HEADER	OBJECT'S FIELD NAME
CCRZ__APINAME__C	ccrz__APIName__c
CCRZ__CONFIGURATIONMETAID__C	
CCRZ__CONFIGURATIONMODULE__C	ccrz__ConfigurationModule__r:ccrz__ConfigurationModuleId__c
CCRZ__DESCRIPTION__C	ccrz__Description__c
CCRZ__EXTERNALLYSAFE__C	ccrz__ExternallySafe__c
ID	ccrz__ConfigurationMetaId__c
NAME	Name
In Data Loader, upsert the CC Configuration records from the CSV file that you exported.
In step 2a of the upsert window in Data Loader, select any field for matching—the destination org doesn't contain any data to match against.
In step 2b of the upsert window in Data Loader, select ccrz__ConfigurationMetaId__c for the external ID to use for matching.
Map the following CSV columns to object fields:
CSV FILE'S COLUMN HEADER	OBJECT'S FIELD NAME
CCRZ__CONFIGURATIONID__C	
CCRZ__CONFIGURATIONMETA__C	ccrz__ConfigurationMeta__r:ccrz__ConfigurationMetaId__c
CCRZ__PAGENAME__C	ccrz__PageName__c
CCRZ__SEQUENCEPRIORITY__C	ccrz__SequencePriority__c
CCRZ__STOREFRONT__C	ccrz__Storefront__c
CCRZ__TEXTVALUE__C	ccrz__TextValue__c
ID	ccrz__ConfigurationId__c
NAME	Name
Update the value of the Default Record Owner configuration of the User Profile (Registration) module so that it references a user ID in your destination org.
NOTE This configuration specifies the ID of the user that owns all records created by a guest user. This value is required so that your storefront complies with security alerts that keep your storefront secure by default. When you migrate configuration data from another org and upsert into a new org, this configuration's value is empty. For help with creating this user in your org, see Create a Default Owner for Records Created by a Storefront Guest User.
In your destination org, build and activate a new configuration cache.
Validate that the migration completed successfully.
Compare the configuration settings between your source org and destination org.
Test storefront functionality in your destination org.
If necessary, adjust any settings. Build and activate a new configuration cache.

title: Migrating B2B Commerce Configuration Data
